div.head:
EmblemeEmblem 6. Of the Secrets of Nature.
SoweSow your gold in the white foliated earth.

lg.l: Rusticks their seed to th'the fertile earth committ,
When with their harrows they have made it fitt:
The Sophi thus their golden seed doe sowe
In foliated earth as white as Snow:
This method well observe, and you'leyou'll behold,
As in a glasse, by wheat, your budding gold.

div.head: Discourse 6.
div.ab:
A City sayth Plato subsistesubsist not by Physician and Physician, but by Physician and
husbandman, that is, men of divers functions, but here mentions the Husbandman
and Physician first, because their worke are very conspicuous in the imitation,-
emendation, and perfection of nature: for they both take a naturall subject,
in which they attending to art add some certaine things necessary being wanting,
or allso remove those things which are superfluous: soe that the art of both may
(as medicine by Hippocrates) be defined by the addition of defect, and subtract
tion of superfluity: for what dos the Husbandman more than add ploughing, ridging
furrowing, harrowing, dunging or manuring, sowing, et. to land left by nature, that
is, commit the increase and good successe to nature, which administreth the heat
of the Sunne, and raine, and multiplyesmultiplies the seeds by them, and promotes them to
standing corne soon after to be reaped: in the meane time whilst the herbe is-
Springing the husbandman weeds out thistles and all impediments, gathers-
the corne being ripe, takes away things superfluous from it being reaped, namely
straw, chaffechaff, and such other things: Soe allso a Physician (as allso a Chymist in
a different respect) teachethteaches how to præserve præsent health to many body, being
wanting to recover it by severall remedyesremedies, takes away the morbifickemorbific cause,
cures the disease, assuagethassuages symptoms, abates superfluous blood by opening
a veyne, being wanting restores it by apointingappointing good order of dyetdiet, evacua
ates noxious humors by purgation, and soe imitates, supplyessupplies, and amends
nature a thousand ways by the works of the understanding and art; which
being notorious, Chymicall things are rather to be considered by us: for Chy
mistry doth first declare the operations of agriculture by its secret bounds-
and wayes of operating: Husbandmen have land, wherein to sow seed, soe allso
the Chymists: They have dung wherewith to manure their ground, soe-
allso these, without which nothing could be done, nor any successe expected:
They have seed, the multiplication of which they desire: if Chymists-
had not the like, they would (as Lully sayth) imitate the painter, that-
endeavouresendeavors to expresseexpress the fate of a certaine man, whome hee had never
seen, nor the image of him: Husbandmen expect raine, and heat of the-
Sunne, soe allso doe the Chymists truely administer heat convenient to
their worke, and raine: I need say noe more: X Chymistry is exactly parallell to agriculture, and its deputy,
which in all things expressethexpresses its offices, but under a most absolute alle
gory-----From hence the Ancients pro

the tincture: White earth, because sandy, yeilds little fruit to the countrymen, by
whome that which is blacke and fatt is more desired, but the white principally
conducethconduces to the Philosophers, if it be foliated, that is well præpared, because-
they know how to enrich it with their dung, the other not at all: Now sowing is
the propagation of the world, whereby that, which cannot long endure in an
individuall, is caused to persist in the Species: This is in man, animalls, and
plants, in these hermaphroditically, in them under two distinct sexes: but in
metalls farre otherwise: for in them a line is made of the flux of a point, a-
superficies of the flux of a line, a body of the flux of a superficies: But-
the Starrs produced that point before the line, superficies, and body, because-
it is the principle of them all: Nature added the flux a long time after, that is,-
the cælestiall Sunne did in the earth generate a Sonne, whome Mercury coḿittedcommitted
